description.narrative:
IATI codes for known vocabularies of development indicators.
The code is meaningful - an acronym of the entity that maintains the indicator repository, along with an additional acronym if the entity maintains multiple repositories (e.g. UN-MDG vs UN-SDG).
In this list, description contains IATI specific usage notes and examples of valid codes within each vocabulary, along with a URL to a sample individual indicator definition if possible.
This list is maintained by the IATI Secretariat, but is a "non-embedded" codelist - which means changes and additions may be made at short notice, outside of published decimal and integer upgrade schedules. If an indicator repository that you wish to use is not on this list, please contact support@iatistandard.org .
Example: "SN.ITK.DEFC.ZS" refers to "Prevalence of undernourishment (% of population)" http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SN.ITK.DEFC.ZS

name.narrative: United Nations Millennium Development Goals Indicators

description.narrative: Example: "6.1" refers to "6.1 HIV prevalence among population aged 15-24 years" http://mdgs.un.org/unsd/mi/wiki/6-1-HIV-prevalence-among-population-aged-15-24-years.ashx
Example: "10" refers to "Prevalence of stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age"
Example: "E-1-05" refers to "Percentage of schools/learning spaces used as shelters in affected area" http://www.humanitarianresponse.info/en/applications/ir/indicator/e-1-05
Example: "1044" refers to "Number of male circumcisions performed" http://www.indicatorregistry.org/?q=node/1044

This registry does not provide a formal, authoritative code for an indicator. Recommend using the iid parameter in the query string. Example: "2245" refers to "Cholera case fatality rate" http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=2445
Example: "3.1.1-24" refers to "Number of individuals who received Testing and Counseling (T&C) services for HIV and received their test results"
Example: "4.5.1(17)" refers to "Kilometers of roads improved or constructed"

name.narrative: U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief

description.narrative: Example: "C2.2.D" refers to "Number of HIV-positive persons receiving Cotrimoxizole (CTX) prophylaxis"
The indicator code used references a private indicator vocabulary maintained by the reporting organisation for this activity.
